citeinfo.origin: US Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water
citeinfo.title: EPA Office of Water (OW): Fish Consumption Advisories and Fish Tissue Sampling Stations NHDPlus Indexed Datasets

descript.abstract: The Fish Consumption Advisories dataset contains information on Fish Advisory events that have been indexed to the EPA Office of Water NHDPlus v2.1 hydrology and stored in the Reach Addressing Database (RAD). NHDPlus is a database that interconnects and uniquely identifies the millions of stream segments or reaches that comprise the Nations' surface water drainage system. NHDPlus provides a national framework for assigning reach addresses to water quality related entities, such as fish advisories locations. Reach addresses establish the locations of these entities relative to one another within the NHD surface water drainage network in a manner similar to street addresses. The assignment of reach addresses is accomplished through a process known as reach indexing. Fish consumption advisories and fish tissue sampling stations are reported to EPA by the states. Sampling stations are the locations where a state has collected fish tissue data for use in advisory determinations. Fish consumption advisory locations are coded onto NHDPlus flowline features to create point and linear events. Fish consumption advisory locations are also coded onto NHDPlus waterbody features to create area events. In addition to NHDPlus-reach indexed data, there may also be custom events (point, line, or area) that are not associated with NHDPlus. Although these Fish consumption advisories are not represented in NHDPlus, the data created for them are in an EPA standard format that is compatible with EPA's Reach Address Database.
descript.purpose: To be used to identify the spatial extent of the fish consumption advisories and fish tissue sampling stations locations. These waters can be linked to the fish consumption advisories and fish tissue sampling stations locations stored in the EPA National Listing of Fish and Wildlife Advisories (NLFWA) database for query and display. The Source_FeatureID field in the event table/shapefile can be linked to the ADVNUM in EPA's NLFWA database.
descript.supplinf: NHD Vintage: NHDPlus 2.1 - Current as of 2013

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness.

horizpa.horizpar: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

vertacc.vertaccr: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS).
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus - NHDPlus

srcinfo.srccontr: NHDPlus v2.1 is the source of all reached indexed events in the EPA Reach Address Database.

procstep.procdesc: Each organization (state, tribe, etc) submitted the locational information for fish consumption advisories and fish tissue sampling stations to EPA. An EPA contractor georeferenced each fish consumption advisory and fish tissue sampling station to the NHD using the Hydrography Event Management (HEM) tool and EPA's HEM add-on tools. Using the HEM tool, NHD event tables were created that contain locational information for each fish consumption advisory and fish tissue sampling station. Event identifiers were populated with the advisory numbers (ADVNUM) that match the associated fish advisory in EPA's National Listing of Fish Advisories (NLFWA) database.

attr.attrdef: 40-char GUID value that uniquely identifies the occurrence of each event.
The date the event was created or updated.

Unique identifier composed of two parts. The first eight digits are the subbasin code defines by FIPS 103, next six digits is a randomly assigned sequential number unique within a Cataloging Unit, length 14.

attrdomv.udom: String value of 14 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Date that the reach code was assigned.
Code for source resolution: 1=Local resolution, 2=High resolution, 3=Medium resolution.
40-char GUID value that uniquely identifies the NHD feature upon which the event is located.
Domain value indicating the type of NHD feature the event is associated with.
The organization responsible for the submission of the data. In most cases this is a state abbreviation.

attrdomv.udom: String value no more than 130 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Supplemental data relevant to the event.

For reached area events, this value is the coefficient of areal correspondence between the event geometry and its parent NHD reach geometry. A value of 1 indicates the area event geometry is equal to the parent reach geometry. The majority of area events in the RAD are equal to the entire parent reach.

attr.attrdef: Count of RAD events having this source feature id.

Initial date the source feature ID was loaded into the reach address database. This represents the date of data processing and has no reflection on the vintage of the events themselves which are expressed through EventDate, Start_Date and Cycle_Year.
Optional date tracking any subsequent updates to the source feature ID.

ID of the authority submitting the source feature ID to the reach address database. This represents the agent doing the indexing and submitting the data through EPA's CDX gateway and does not represent the source of the data which is designated via the Source Originator field.
Total count of all point events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Total length in kilometers of all line events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Total area in square kilometers of all area events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Vendor-required unique numeric key.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Environmental Protection Agency, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.

digtinfo.formcont: These spatial files represent the most up-to-date publicly available Water program data by State or arbitrary region from the Reach Address Database (RAD).

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
